thread.title: Thiessen, Oil Caps power past Pistons
thread.title_full: Thiessen, Oil Caps power past Pistons

title: Thiessen, Oil Caps power past Pistons
text:
Thiessen, Oil Caps power past Pistons By: Uncredited 
Dylan Thiessen scored one goal and set up another for the Virden Oil Capitals in their 5-2 Manitoba Junior Hockey League victory over the Steinbach Pistons on Sunday. 
Sean Kuehn made 28 saves in net. 
In Sunday’s other game, it was: OCN Blizzard 4, Winnipeg Blues 3 in a shootout. 
On Saturday, it was: Oil Capitals 6, Selkirk Steelers 3; Winkler Flyers 4, Waywayseecappo Wolverines 2; Blizzard 7, Neepawa Natives 1; Portage Terriers 2, Dauphin Kings 0; and Swan Valley Stampeders 5, Blues 4 in a shootout. 
In Virden, Cody Durdle, Devan Schram, Bennett Dalke and Dylan Cusmano netted the other markers for the Oil Caps (6-3-0). Hayden Goderis and Matthieu Gomercic replied for the Pistons (6-4-0). 
Blizzard 4 Blues 3 (SO) 
At The Pas, Cole McCartan scored in the shootout winner while Jeremy Dumont and Logan Harland both had a goal and an assist in regulation time for the Blizzard (5-5-2). Kamerin Nault netted a marker and set up another for the Blues (4-5-3). 
Oil Capitals 6 Steelers 3 
At Virden, Dalke scored a pair of goals, including one on a penalty shot, while Devan Schram picked up three helpers for the Oil Capitals. Tanner Lewis added a goal for his hometown team. Brandon Bartley, Brady Castellano and Victor Knaub replied for the Steelers (4-5-0). 
Flyers 4 Wolverines 2 
At Winkler, Jeff Michiels of Holland opened the scoring and Jordan Williamson set up the final two goals for the Flyers (8-2-1). Alex Keena and Killarney’s Brett Opperman set up each other’s goals for the Wolverines (3-6-2). 
Blizzard 7 Natives 1 
At The Pas, Harland (two goals, three assists) and Dumont (one goal, four assists) both had five-point nights for the Blizzard, while Devin Muir netted a pair of goals and set up two others. Brody Claeys of Ste. Rose du Lac made 28 saves in net. Nathan Hillis replied for Neepawa (5-7-0), which got 39 saves from Jeremy Link. 
Terriers 2 Kings 0 
At Dauphin, Elkhorn’s Brad Bowles scored a short-handed marker in the first that held up as the winner for the Terriers (10-1-0). Kyler Carter also scored with Nathan Park stopping 29 shots for the shutout. Jarrod Schamerhorn made 33 saves for the Kings (5-5-0). 
Stampeders 5 Blues 4 (SO) 
At Swan River, Tanner Koroscil of Birtle had a goal and an assist while Cody Ellingson was the only shooter to score in the shootout for the Stampeders (3-7-1). Ryan Mutch gave Winnipeg a 4-2 lead midway through the third. 
» The Brandon Sun
